main event: A sighting of a silver object in Fayetteville, North Carolina on October 8, 1960.
interesting points: The object was approximately half-dollar in size and had flashing lights., The observed object was thought to be a new Lear Jet experimental model being tested in the area., The object seemed to hover before disappearing., The weather conditions were clear with broad sunlight during the observation., The report suggests that the object might have been a reflection of sunlight on a high-flying aircraft.
sighted object: one silver object with flashing lights
witness description: The witness is a reliable electrical engineer employed by Carolina Power & Light Co.
